Latest News

Students protest for guns on campus

Students nationwide participated in what they called “The Empty Holster Protest.” They want to be allowed to carry guns on campus. [Read More]

Military vets struggle with transition

Enrolling in college after military service can be a struggle. Some veterans at UNC have had a difficult transition to civilian life. [Read More]

Chapel Hill bookstore finds its niche

Despite the struggles some traditional book-sellers are encountering, one small local store is developing a niche in Chapel Hill. [Read More]

Kuralt recalled as ‘American Hero’

UNC remembers Charles Kuralt, a Carolina alum and long-time CBS reporter known for his characteristic baritone voice and literary wit. [Read More]

Carolina men fight ‘Bad Game Syndrome’

The social life of some Carolina men is hampered by "Bad Game Syndrome." But senior Louie Horvath's story is one of triumph. [Read More]

Fifteen years of saving animals

Chapel Hill resident Betsy Banks Saul co-founded petfinder.com- an adoption website for rescue and shelter animals. [Read More]

UNC students return early from Japan

UNC has canceled study abroad programs in Japan following last month's earthquake. Two students -- now safely back at home -- recall their experience. [Read More]

Students share LDOC plans

Students talk about their plans for the last day of classes, or -- as it's called at Carolina -- "LDOC." [Read More]

Social media sites source of viruses

As social media websites become more popular, they're also becoming a source of malware and viruses. Some UNC students have learned that lesson the hard way. [Read More]

Somoano named men’s soccer coach

Newly-appointed head men's soccer coach Carlos Somoano is the second minority head coach and the first ever Hispanic head coach at UNC. [Read More]
